item.title: 2025 Honda Activa 125 launched — Here’s what’s new - The Financial Express
item.description:
2025 Honda Activa 125 Launched — Here’s What’s New

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Financial Express

Honda has launched the updated Activa 125 in India, featuring enhanced aesthetics and functionality.

  • The updated Activa 125 is priced at Rs 94,422 (DLX variant) and Rs 97,146 (H-Smart variant).
  • New color options include Pearl Igneous Black, Matt Axis Gray Metallic, Pearl Deep Ground Gray, Pearl Siren Blue, Rebel Red Metallic, and Pearl Precious White.
  • The new instrument console includes a 4.2-inch TFT display with Bluetooth connectivity for navigation and alerts.
  • The Activa retains its 123.9cc engine, producing 8.3bhp and 10.5Nm of torque, with CVT gearbox and idling start-stop feature.
“The updated Honda Activa 125 gets added features and new color options.”

The 2025 Honda Activa 125 offers a blend of classic design and modern features, catering to the evolving needs of customers.

item.title: Zerodha’s ‘time spent with coworkers, parents’ graphs hit people right in the feels: 'Sad on so many levels’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Zerodha’s ‘time spent with coworkers, parents’ graphs hit people right in the feels: 'Sad on so many levels’

Date: Dec 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Zerodha's recent post about time spent with coworkers versus family has struck an emotional chord online, prompting relatable and humorous comments on social media.

  • The graphs shared depict how much time people spend with coworkers compared to parents, pets, and at home.
  • Commentary on the post revealed a mix of emotional resonance and humor.
  • People expressed feelings of sadness as well as appreciation for the reminder of work-life balance.
“This is just what I needed to see today! Thanks!”

This portrayal serves to highlight the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance, especially in today's demanding work environment.

item.title: Donald Trump transfers nearly $4 billion worth of his Trump Media shares to revocable trust | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Donald Trump Transfers Nearly $4 Billion Worth of Trump Media Shares to Revocable Trust

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

US President-elect Donald Trump has transferred all his stake in Trump Media & Technology worth over $4 billion to a revocable trust of which he is the sole beneficiary.

  • Trump transferred 114.75 million shares, representing 53% of the company’s stock, as a “bona fide gift” to the Donald J. Trump Revocable Trust.
  • Trump’s son, Donald Trump Jr., is the sole trustee with voting and investment power.
  • Trump previously stated he had no intention of selling his shares in the company.
  • Trump Media was created after Trump's social media ban following the January 6 Capitol riot.
  • The company went public on NASDAQ in March 2024, with shares experiencing volatility.
  • As of Friday, Trump Media shares were down about 2% at $34.71.
“Trump Media shares have remained volatile and the stock touched intraday highs near $80 on the first day of trading.”

In conclusion, the transfer of shares to a revocable trust might indicate a strategic financial maneuver by Trump, though the reasons remain unclear.

item.title: US judge rules Israel's NSO Group liable for hacking WhatsApp using Pegasus spyware - The Times of India
item.description:
US Judge Rules Israel's NSO Group Liable for Hacking WhatsApp Using Pegasus Spyware

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

A US judge has determined that Israel's NSO Group is liable for utilizing the Pegasus spyware to hack into WhatsApp, raising significant concerns about privacy and surveillance.

  • The ruling comes as part of a legal battle involving NSO Group and the messaging platform, WhatsApp.
  • Pegasus is a powerful spyware that can access messages, calls, and other private data on targeted devices.
  • This case marks a notable moment in the ongoing debate around digital privacy and the ethics of surveillance technologies.
“This ruling underscores the serious implications of hacking and surveillance on personal privacy.”

This decision may lead to greater scrutiny of surveillance practices and potential regulation of spyware technology.

item.title: US judge rules NSO Group liable for hacking WhatsApp with Pegasus spyware - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Transrail Lighting IPO: Latest GMP, review, subscription status, other details; Issue ends on Monday— Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Transrail Lighting IPO: Latest GMP, review, subscription status, other details; Issue ends on Monday— Apply or not?

Publication Date: December 19, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Transrail Lighting's IPO was completely subscribed in just hours after bids opened, with significant interest from retail and non-institutional investors.

  • The IPO was subscribed 5.31 times overall as of Friday, December 20.
  • Retail investors' shares were subscribed at a rate of 6.90 times.
  • Non-institutional investors showed even more interest with a subscription rate of 7.23 times.
  • The QIB category had a subscription level of 1.38 times.
  • The price band for the IPO was set between ₹410-432 per share.
  • The offering will close on December 23, 2023, after generating ₹245.97 crore through the anchor book.
  • At the top of the price range, the IPO values Transrail Lighting at ₹839 crore, with a total market capitalization of approximately ₹5,600 crore.
  • Transrail Lighting specializes in power transmission and distribution and has integrated manufacturing facilities.
  • The latest GMP is ₹186, with an estimated listing price of ₹618.
“Transrail Lighting stands out as a prominent EPC company in India.”

Investors are encouraged to consider the strong subscription rates and the company's standing in the market.

item.title: Dividend, bonus, stock split: Vedanta to trade ex-dividend, NMDC to trade ex-bonus next week; Full list | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Vedanta to Trade Ex-Dividend and NMDC to Trade Ex-Bonus Next Week

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Vedanta Limited is set to trade ex-dividend while NMDC is to trade ex-bonus starting December 23, 2024. Several corporations are implementing stock splits, bonus issues, and holding extraordinary general meetings as per BSE data.

  • Vedanta: Declared interim dividend of ₹8.5, trading ex-dividend on December 24, 2024.
  • Bharat Global Developers Ltd: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹1, trading ex-split on December 26, 2024.
  • Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders: Stock split from ₹10 to ₹5, trading ex-split on December 27, 2024.
  • Bonus Issues: Bharat Global Developers will issue bonus shares in the ratio of 8:10; NMDC will issue 2:1 bonus shares.
  • EGMs and InvIT: Various companies such as Milkfood and Norben Tea & Exports will hold extraordinary general meetings next week.
“The day when the equity share price adjusts to show the next dividend payout is known as the ex-dividend date.”

This week marks a notable period for investors as several key corporate actions will take place, impacting share prices and trading conditions.

item.title: WhatsApp Wins Lawsuit Against Pegasus Maker As US Judge Finds NSO Guilty In Spyware Case - News18
item.description:
WhatsApp Wins Lawsuit Against NSO Group in Spyware Case

Date: December 21, 2024

Source: News18

WhatsApp has achieved a legal victory against the NSO Group, which is known for developing the Pegasus spyware. A US judge ruled that NSO Group violated US hacking laws and WhatsApp's terms of service.

  • WhatsApp filed the lawsuit accusing NSO of hacking 1,400 individuals in May 2019.
  • The judge ruled in favor of WhatsApp, stating that NSO's actions were illegal.
  • A jury trial is scheduled for March 2025 to determine the damages owed to WhatsApp.
  • WhatsApp emphasized the need for accountability for spyware companies targeting vulnerable groups.
  • NSO was found to be non-cooperative during the case and faced sanctions for not providing necessary information.
  • The US government blacklisted NSO in 2021, prohibiting its agencies from utilizing its products.
NSO must be held accountable for targeting journalists, human rights activists, and civil society groups.

This ruling marks a significant win for WhatsApp in its ongoing battle against spyware and underscores the rising scrutiny on tech companies involved in such practices.

item.title: Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate - NDTV
item.description:
Shark Tank's Namita Thapar And Anupam Mittal Clash Over 70-Hour Workweek Debate

Publication Date: November 14, 2023

Source: Undisclosed

This article discusses the ongoing debate about work hours in India, sparked by comments from Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy regarding a 70-hour workweek. Judges from 'Shark Tank India', Namita Thapar and Anupam Mittal, share their contrasting views on the subject.

  • Anupam Mittal believes that productivity cannot be measured by hours worked.
  • Namita Thapar argues for reasonable work limits for regular employees to protect their health and well-being.
  • Thapar highlights the disparity between high-level stakeholders and regular employees regarding workload expectations.
  • The debate was reignited by Narayana Murthy's call for increased productivity among India's youth.
Anupam Mittal: "I think it is a big lie... you are not going to achieve anything extraordinary in life by counting the hours that you are putting in."
Namita Thapar: "Basically this whole discussion... is a crock of bullsh*t."

In conclusion, the debate raises important questions about work-life balance and the implications of excessive work hours on health and family life.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani and his choti bahu Radhika Merchant spotted in India's most expensive LMV, a 5-star suite on wh - India.com
item.description:
Mukesh Ambani and Radhika Merchant Spotted in India's Most Expensive Luxury MPV

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 Source: India.com

Mukesh Ambani, Asia’s richest man, and his daughter-in-law Radhika Merchant were recently seen in their new luxury MPV, a Lexus LM 350H, which is priced at Rs 3 crore.

  • The Lexus LM 350H is currently India’s most expensive MPV.
  • The vehicle includes luxurious features such as leather upholstery, reclining seats, and advanced entertainment systems.
  • Ambani and Merchant were spotted outside the Dhirubhai Ambani International School in Mumbai.
“The interior of the Lexus MPV is the best money can buy, boasting leather upholstery and advanced safety features.”

This addition to the Ambani family’s car collection showcases their penchant for luxury vehicles.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani makes BIG move, buys 45% stake in..., deal is worth Rs 849525000, its business is... - India.com
item.description:
Mukesh Ambani Acquires 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group for $10 Million

Publication Date: December 21, 2023 | Source: India.com

In a major move, billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries announced that its wholly owned subsidiary, Reliance Digital Health Ltd, is set to acquire a 45 percent stake in US-based healthcare firm Health Alliance Group Inc for $10 million. The investment aims to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform.

  • The investment is part of Reliance's strategy to improve healthcare access for underserved communities.
  • No related party transactions are involved.
  • The transaction is expected to be completed in around two weeks.
  • Health Alliance Group Inc specializes in technology-driven solutions for healthcare across the US and India.
“The investment will empower Reliance Digital to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform, expanding access to healthcare for underserved communities.” - Reliance Industries

This acquisition reinforces Reliance Industries’ commitment to expanding its footprint in the healthcare sector and enhancing technological integration in health services.

item.title: IRFC Share Price: Should you BUY top railway stock in 2025? - ET Now
item.description:
IRFC Share Price: Should you BUY top railway stock in 2025?

Updated on: Dec 20, 2024 - Source: ET NOW

IRFC, a company under the Ministry of Railways, had issued its shares at Rs 26 through IPO and has delivered an impressive return of over 800%, reaching an all-time high of Rs 229.05 in July 2024. However, after a sharp correction, the stock is now trading at a 33% discount, closing at Rs 153 on NSE.

Key Points

  • Experts recommend investing in IRFC for long-term returns of 6-12 months or more.
  • The railway sector is undergoing transformation focused on infrastructure development and enhancing passenger experience.
  • IRFC shares have delivered positive returns of 52% in BSE data, with impressive multibagger returns over 365% and 570% in the last two and three years, respectively.
  • The company boasts a dividend yield of 0.98% and a market valuation of Rs 1,99,752.11 crore.
Gaurang Shah, market expert: "An IRFC investor should invest only if he/she has long-term views... you will be rewarded very good."

Overall, investing in IRFC is perceived as a long-term strategy given the current market corrections.

item.title: Bajaj Chetak 35 Series available in eight colours - BikeWale
item.description:
Bajaj Chetak 35 Series available in eight colours

Date: October 2023, Source: BikeWale

Bajaj Auto recently launched the new-generation Chetak 35 Series in India, priced from Rs. 1.20 lakh (ex-showroom). The electric scooter is available in eight color options across two main variants.

  • 3501 and 3502 variants available with five colours each.
  • Each variant gets a few unique colours.
  • Powered by a 3.5kWh battery pack with a certified range of 153km.
  • Top speed of 73kph with a new 4kW permanent magnet motor.
  • Features a five-inch TFT touchscreen display with integrated maps.
Bajaj claims that the new Chetak features the largest boot space in the EV segment at 35 litres.

The Bajaj Chetak 35 Series represents an evolution in design and performance, enhancing the electric scooter experience for customers.

item.title: Besides Maruti, Hyundai & Toyota, More Brands To Introduce Hybrid Cars In India - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Besides Maruti, Hyundai & Toyota, More Brands To Introduce Hybrid Cars In India

Publication Date: April 2024 Source: Gaadi Waadi

Several car manufacturers are set to enter the hybrid SUV market in India, including Maruti Suzuki and Toyota, with new models anticipated in 2025.

  • Maruti Suzuki and Toyota are launching new three-row hybrid SUVs, the Grand Vitara and Urban Cruiser Hyryder, expected in early 2025.
  • Reports suggest a mid-life update for Maruti's Fronx model, featuring a strong hybrid system with over 30 kmpl fuel efficiency.
  • Hyundai is developing a premium SUV expected to hit dealerships in the next two and a half years.
  • The new Hyundai SUV aims to compete with Mahindra XUV700 and Tata Safari.
"The hybrid car segment will see plenty of action but in a gradual manner."

The increasing interest in hybrid vehicles signals a shift towards more sustainable automotive technology in India.

item.title: Failure To Hand Over Commercial Space To Purchasers Is 'Deficiency In Service': Delhi State Commission - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Failure To Hand Over Commercial Space To Purchasers Is 'Deficiency In Service': Delhi State Commission

Date: 09.12.2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Delhi State Commission has declared a failure to deliver commercial space by Parsvnath developers as 'deficiency in service,' emphasizing that purchasers cannot be indefinitely delayed in receiving their property.

  • Complainants booked office space in Parsvnath City Center Bhiwadi.
  • Contract stipulated completion within 30 months, but the project was abandoned.
  • After a nine-year delay and no response from the developer, the complainants sought compensation.
  • The Commission ruled in favor of the complainants, citing Consumer Protection Act.
  • Reliefs granted include full refund with interest, compensation for mental agony, and litigation costs.
“Purchasers cannot be made to wait for an indefinite period of time.”

The ruling reinforces consumer rights in property agreements and the obligation of developers to fulfill contractual obligations.

item.title: 'I Cried On Google Meet': Indian Techie Exposes Toxic 15-Hour Work Culture At Startup - Times Now
item.description:
Indian Techie Exposes Toxic 15-Hour Work Culture at Startup

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times Now News

An Indian tech professional shared a heartfelt post on Reddit, revealing allegations of verbal abuse by a startup co-founder and outlining the oppressive 15-hour work culture at the company.

  • The techie described a video call incident where he cried due to the founder's abuse.
  • He accused the co-founder of demanding excessive work hours without clear guidance.
  • Social media users offered supportive advice in response to the post.
  • The techie plans to seek new job opportunities while still employed at the startup.
“I cried on Google Meet in front of the tech lead. I don’t know how to face it now,” the techie stated.

The incident highlights the impact of workplace toxicity on mental health, as well as the support systems available through online communities.

item.title: Reliance Industries arm to acquire 45% stake in Health Alliance Group for $10 million | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Industries to Acquire 45% Stake in Health Alliance Group

Publication Date: December 21, 2023

Source: LiveMint

Reliance Digital Health Ltd, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, is set to acquire a 45% equity stake in Health Alliance Group Inc. for $10 million. This investment aims to enhance healthcare access for underserved communities through a virtual diagnostic and care platform.

  • Reliance Industries announced the agreement on December 21, 2023.
  • The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and is expected to finalize within two weeks.
  • No regulatory approvals are required for the acquisition.
  • Health Alliance Group specializes in technology-driven healthcare solutions targeting underserved populations.
“The investment will empower Reliance Digital to develop a virtual diagnostic and care platform.”

The acquisition reflects Reliance's commitment to improving healthcare accessibility and aligns with its digital health strategy.

item.title: Rs 18 Lakh Discount On Rs 55 Lakh Imported Car! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Massive Discounts on Skoda Superb Sedan in India

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: MotorOctane

Skoda is offering discounts on its premium sedan, the Superb, in India to clear unsold inventory. The discount can be as much as Rs 18 lakh, making the on-road price approximately Rs 38 lakh.

  • Skoda re-introduced the Superb in India in 2024 as a CBU model.
  • The sedan was initially priced at Rs 54 lakh but did not sell well.
  • Reports indicate that 20-25 unsold units remain, leading to significant discounts.
  • Buyers should note the model is the 3rd generation and will be two years old by 2025.
“With such a hefty discount is the Skoda Superb a perfect choice for you?”

This discount represents an opportunity for buyers looking for a premium sedan at a reduced price, despite the age of the model.

item.title: Stock to buy in 2025: HAL, IPCA Labs among 6 mid and smallcap stock ideas from Mirae Asset Sharekhan - The Economic Times
item.description:
Stock to buy in 2025: HAL, IPCA Labs among 6 mid and smallcap stock ideas from Mirae Asset Sharekhan

Date: Dec 21, 2024, Source: Economic Times

Indian equity markets showed strong performance in 2024, although momentum slowed in the final quarter due to global macroeconomic issues. For 2025, Mirae Asset Sharekhan anticipates consolidation, highlighting midcap and smallcap stocks such as HAL and IPCA Laboratories.

  • Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL): Strong growth with a projected ROE of 21.8% in FY25 due to robust defense orders.
  • IPCA Laboratories: Key player in pharmaceuticals, aiming for an ROE of 13.0% in FY25 driven by product launches.
  • L&T Technology Services (LTTS): Expected ROE of 23.9% in FY25, benefitting from demand in engineering services.
  • Persistent Systems: Anticipated ROE of 25.6% in FY25 backed by cloud computing and AI advancements.
  • Mastek: Projected ROE of 16.3% in FY25, focusing on digital transformation.
  • Wonderla Holidays: Expected ROE of 11.7% in FY25, expanding into new cities.
“Recommendations, suggestions, views, and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times.”

The focus on midcap and smallcap stocks reflects a strategic shift towards sectors poised for growth amidst volatile market conditions.

item.title: Buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy on Monday — 23 December 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sumeet Bagadia's Stock Recommendations for December 23, 2024

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Introduction

Amidst a downturn in the Indian stock market, Sumeet Bagadia, Executive Director at Choice Broking, recommends three stocks to buy to navigate these challenging conditions.

Key Points

  • Indian stock market suffers significant losses with the Nifty 50 index dropping from 23,768 to 23,587.
  • Sumeet Bagadia advises caution as the market may approach a critical support level at 23,250.
  • Recommended stocks for buying: Titan Company, Petronet LNG, and Dr Reddy's Laboratories.

Stock Details

  • Titan Company: Buy at ₹3356.25, target ₹3555, stop loss ₹3222.
  • Petronet LNG: Buy at ₹336.45, target ₹355, stop loss ₹323.
  • Dr Reddy's Laboratories: Buy at ₹1343.65, target ₹1425, stop loss ₹1295.

Notable Quotes

“The overall Indian stock market bias has weakened as the Nifty 50 index has slipped below 200-DEMA support.”

Conclusion

Investors are advised to consider Bagadia's recommendations carefully in light of current market conditions, while also remaining aware of potential risks.

item.title: Google exec says job which doesn't need a college degree is in high demand - Hindustan Times
item.description:
High Demand for Data Analytics Jobs Without College Degrees

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The demand for data analytics jobs that do not require a college degree is rising, with the US Bureau of Labor Statistics predicting over 30% growth in the field over the next decade.

  • Data analysts can earn six-figure salaries without a traditional degree.
  • Google's Lisa Gevelber highlights the importance of data understanding in business decisions.
  • Skills in data analytics are highly sought after, emphasizing practical training over formal education.
  • The entry-level salary for data analysts averages around $93,000; experienced professionals can make up to $110,000 or more in certain sectors.
“The demand for people who understand data and can use it to guide important business decisions is huge.” - Lisa Gevelber

This trend emphasizes the growing importance of skill-based learning in the labor market.

item.title: 2025: A tale of two halves; ICICI Bank, Zomato among Motilal Oswal’s top 10 picks - The Economic Times
item.description:
2025: A tale of two halves; ICICI Bank, Zomato among Motilal Oswal’s top 10 picks

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

This article discusses the projected market trends for 2025, highlighting a recovery in the second half after a muted first half, driven by increased rural spending and government expenditure.

Key Points:

  • 2025 is forecasted to be a year of market consolidation in the first half, followed by recovery.
  • MOFSL predicts earnings growth of 16% CAGR over FY25-27E.
  • Key stock picks include ICICI Bank, HCL Technologies, Zomato, and others.
  • Market influences include RBI rate cuts and global economic changes.
  • Five major triggers for market activity identified for 2025.
“The year 2025 could unfold as a tale of two halves. The first half may continue to see market consolidation, while a recovery could take place in the second half.”

The analysis indicates that despite challenges, there are strong fundamentals supporting a market rebound, particularly in large-cap sectors.

item.title: Once endorsed by MS Dhoni, this soap brand was forgotten. Now, Anand Mahindra to start buying | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Once endorsed by MS Dhoni, this soap brand was forgotten. Now, Anand Mahindra to start buying

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Anand Mahindra, chairperson of Mahindra Group, has shared nostalgic feelings about the Mysore Sandal Soap and plans to buy it again, highlighting its enduring popularity.

"Overwhelmed by nostalgia upon seeing this clip. Delighted to see that it survives—and thrives. Going to start buying it again and inhaling the fragrance of tradition!" — Anand Mahindra

Mysore Sandal Soap Expansion Plans

  • The soap is produced by Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL).
  • KSDL plans to add nearly 480 new distributors across India in 2025.
  • The soap is predominantly available in southern states, with Andhra Pradesh being the largest consumer.
  • KSDL reported a turnover of ₹1,500 crore in March 2024, the highest in 40 years.

The company aims to reach new markets including Jammu and Kashmir, Nagaland, and Gujarat, alongside a revamp of the product’s branding.
